item.title: With desire the world is tied down. With the subduing of desire it's freed. With the abandoning of desire all bonds are cut through.

dwob.translator: Translated from Pāli by Thanissaro Bhikkhu
dwob.pali: Icchāya bajjhatī loko. Icchāvinayāya muccati. Icchāya vippahānena sabbaṃ chindati bandhanaṃ.
dwob.translated: With desire the world is tied down. With the subduing of desire it's freed. With the abandoning of desire all bonds are cut through.

item.title: Having killed anger you sleep in ease. Having killed anger you do not grieve. The noble ones praise the slaying of anger -- with its honeyed crest & poison root -- for having killed it you do not grieve.

dwob.translator: Translated from Pāli by Thanissaro Bhikkhu
dwob.pali: Kodhaṃ chetvā sukhaṃ seti. Kodhaṃ chetvā na socati. Kodhassa visamūlassa, madhuraggassa devate vadhaṃ ariyā pasaṃsanti, tañhi chetvā na socatī.
dwob.translated: Having killed anger you sleep in ease. Having killed anger you do not grieve. The noble ones praise the slaying of anger -- with its honeyed crest & poison root -- for having killed it you do not grieve.

item.title: If you hold yourself dear then don't fetter yourself with evil, for happiness isn't easily gained by one who commits a wrong-doing.

dwob.translator: Translated from Pāli by Thanissaro Bhikkhu
dwob.pali: Attānañce piyaṃ jaññā na naṃ pāpena saṃyuje, na hi taṃ sulabhaṃ hoti sukhaṃ dukkaṭakārinā.
dwob.translated: If you hold yourself dear then don't fetter yourself with evil, for happiness isn't easily gained by one who commits a wrong-doing.

item.title: Winning gives birth to hostility. Losing, one lies down in pain. The calmed lie down with ease, having set winning & losing aside.

dwob.translator: Translated from Pāli by Thanissaro Bhikkhu
dwob.pali: Jayaṃ veraṃ pasavati. Dukkhaṃ seti parājito. Upasanto sukhaṃ seti, hitvā jayaparājayaṃ.
dwob.translated: Winning gives birth to hostility. Losing, one lies down in pain. The calmed lie down with ease, having set winning & losing aside.

item.title: Let no one deceive another or despise anyone anywhere, or through anger or irritation wish for another to suffer.

dwob.translator: Translated from Pāli by Thanissaro Bhikkhu
dwob.pali: Na paro paraṃ nikubbetha nātimaññetha katthaci na kañci, byārosanā paṭighasaññā nāññamaññassa dukkhamiccheyya.
dwob.translated: Let no one deceive another or despise anyone anywhere, or through anger or irritation wish for another to suffer.

item.title: One who does not strike nor makes others strike, who robs not nor makes others rob, sharing love with all that live, finds enmity with none.

dwob.translator: Gemstones of the Good Dhamma, compiled and translated by Ven. S. Dhammika
dwob.pali: Yo na hanti na ghāteti, na jināti na jāpaye, mettaṃso sabbabhūtānaṃ, veraṃ tassa na kenacī.
dwob.translated: One who does not strike nor makes others strike, who robs not nor makes others rob, sharing love with all that live, finds enmity with none.

item.title: Hate brings great misfortune, hate churns up and harms the mind; this fearful danger deep within most people do not understand.

dwob.translator: Gemstones of the Good Dhamma, compiled and translated by Ven. S. Dhammika
dwob.pali: Anatthajanano doso, doso cittappakopano; bhayamantarato jātaṃ taṃ jano nāvabujjhati.
dwob.translated: Hate brings great misfortune, hate churns up and harms the mind; this fearful danger deep within most people do not understand.

item.title: One should first establish oneself in what is proper and only then try to instruct others. Doing this, the wise one will not be criticized.

dwob.translator: Gemstones of the Good Dhamma, compiled and translated by Ven. S. Dhammika
dwob.pali: Attānameva paṭhamaṃ patirūpe nivesaye athaññamanusāseyya na kilisseyya paṇḍito.
dwob.translated: One should first establish oneself in what is proper and only then try to instruct others. Doing this, the wise one will not be criticized.
